definition: (of a document) not bearing a name/unregistered (financial securities etc)/bearer (bond)/secret (ballot etc)/anonymous/unattributed (remarks)/(of a check) payable to the bearer
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: The union has balloted its members in pursuit of a pay claim.
sentences.chinese: 为了要求加薪，工会让其成员进行无记名投票表决。

sentences.english: Anonymous e-money works just like real paper cash.
sentences.chinese: 无记名电子货币根一般的纸钞是一样的。

sentences.english: Those are exactly the values promoted by Save Our Secret Ballot.
sentences.chinese: 这正是《拯救我们的无记名投票》所推行的价值观。

sentences.english: China is already having secret ballot and competitive elections at the local level.
sentences.chinese: 中国已在地方实行无记名投票和差额选举。

definition: see 無記名|无记名[wu2 ji4 ming2]
competitive election (i.e. with more candidates than seats)
non-competitive election (i.e. with as many candidates as there are seats)/single-candidate election
to read ballot slips out loud
